introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.text: Welcome to the Canadian Tui Na Association website. By accessing and using our website, you agree to comply with and be bound by the following terms and conditions. Please read them carefully. If you do not agree with any part of these terms and conditions, please do not use our website.

use_of_the_website.title: Use of the Website
use_of_the_website.eligibility: Eligibility: You must be at least 18 years old to use our website and services.
use_of_the_website.account_responsibility: Account Responsibility: If you create an account on our website, you are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account information and password. You agree to accept responsibility for all activities that occur under your account.
use_of_the_website.prohibited_conduct: Prohibited Conduct: You agree not to use our website for any unlawful purpose or to engage in any conduct that may harm the Canadian Tui Na Association, its members, or other users.

membership_and_services.title: Membership and Services
membership_and_services.membership_application: Membership Application: By applying for membership, you agree to provide accurate and complete information. The Canadian Tui Na Association reserves the right to accept or decline any membership application at its discretion.
membership_and_services.membership_benefits: Membership Benefits: Membership benefits are provided as described on our website and are subject to change without notice.
membership_and_services.payment: Payment: Membership fees and other charges are processed through secure payment methods. By providing payment information, you agree to the terms and conditions of the payment processor (e.g., Stripe).

content_and_intellectual_property.title: Content and Intellectual Property
content_and_intellectual_property.website_content: Website Content: All content on our website, including text, graphics, logos, and images, is the property of the Canadian Tui Na Association or its content suppliers and is protected by copyright and other intellectual property laws.
content_and_intellectual_property.use_of_content: Use of Content: You may not reproduce, distribute, or exploit any content from our website without prior written permission from the Canadian Tui Na Association.

limitation_of_liability.title: Limitation of Liability
limitation_of_liability.no_warranty: No Warranty: The Canadian Tui Na Association provides the website and its services "as is" and without any warranty or condition, express, implied, or statutory. We do not guarantee that the website will be error-free or uninterrupted.
limitation_of_liability.liability_limitation: Liability Limitation: In no event shall the Canadian Tui Na Association be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages arising from the use of or inability to use our website or services.

governing_law.title: Governing Law
governing_law.text: These terms and conditions are governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the Province of Ontario and the federal laws of Canada applicable therein. Any disputes arising out of or relating to these terms and conditions shall be resolved in the courts of the Province of Quebec.

changes_to_terms_and_conditions.title: Changes to the Terms and Conditions
changes_to_terms_and_conditions.text: The Canadian Tui Na Association reserves the right to update or modify these terms and conditions at any time without prior notice. Your continued use of the website following any changes constitutes your acceptance of the new terms and conditions.

contact_us.title: Contact Us
contact_us.text: If you have any questions about these terms and conditions, please contact us at:
